name: Sandstorm
text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

editions.flavor: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.
Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

Better to fight the sand for a few hours than to sleep beneath it forever.
—Suq'Ata truism
Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.
Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

name: Sandstorm Charger
text: Megamorph {4}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor:
"May our foes choke upon its horns!"
—Urdnan, Dromoka warrior

name: Sandstorm Eidolon
text:
{R}, Sacrifice Sandstorm Eidolon: Target creature can't block this turn.
Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, you may return Sandstorm Eidolon from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Sangrite Backlash
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-3.

editions.flavor:
"Sangrite is the dragon's beating heart. Little wonder, then, that so many fools' chests burst trying to contain it."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Sangrite Surge
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains double strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Some believe the spiky crystal called sangrite is concentrated dragon's breath. Others think it's crystallized life energy. The clans care only about the power it unleashes when crushed.

name: Sangromancer
text:
Flying
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may gain 3 life.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may gain 3 life.

name: Sangrophage
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Sangrophage unless you pay 2 life.

editions.flavor: The living is all it eats.

name: Sanguimancy
text: You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is your devotion to black. (Each {B} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to black.)

name: Sanguinary Mage
text: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: New cults rising in Nephalia have found allies in the Stromkirk bloodline, whose progenitor worships ancient and terrible forces.

name: Sanguine Bond
text: Whenever you gain life, target opponent loses that much life.

editions.flavor:
"Blood is constant. Every drop I drink, someone must bleed."
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus

"Blood is constant. Every drop I drink, someone must bleed."
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus

"Blood is constant. Every drop I drink, someone must bleed."
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus

name: Sanguine Guard
text:
First strike
{1}{B}: Regenerate Sanguine Guard.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
editions.flavor:
"Father of Machines! Your filigree gaze carves us, and the scars dance upon our grateful flesh."
—Phyrexian Scriptures

"Father of Machines! Your filigree gaze carves us, and the scars dance upon our grateful flesh."
—Phyrexian Scriptures

name: Sanguine Praetor
text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy each creature with the same converted mana cost as the sacrificed creature.

editions.flavor:
"Our fealty to guilds dooms us. The old gods shall resurface. Our skins will wave upon the guild-masts over emptied streets, and our bones will clatter in the wind."
—Ilromov, traveling storyteller

name: Sanitarium Skeleton
text: {2}{B}: Return Sanitarium Skeleton from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: His mind was lost long before his flesh.

name: Sanity Gnawers
text: When Sanity Gnawers enters the battlefield, target player discards a card at random.

editions.flavor: The last thought to go through their victim's mind is the one they tear out through the scalp.

name: Sanity Grinding
text: Chroma — Reveal the top ten cards of your library. For each blue mana symbol in the mana costs of the revealed cards, target opponent puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Then put the cards you revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Sapling of Colfenor
text:
Indestructible
Whenever Sapling of Colfenor attacks, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, you gain life equal to that card's toughness, lose life equal to its power, then put it into your hand.

editions.flavor: Her plans may yet bear fruit.

name: Sapphire Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Target player draws a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
• Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
• Target creature an opponent controls phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)

name: Sapphire Drake
text:
Flying
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has flying.

editions.flavor: Sapphire drakes can communicate over great distances, their calls resonating in the gems fixed in their skulls.

name: Sapphire Leech
text:
Flying
Blue spells you cast cost {U} more to cast.

editions.flavor:
"The subject's wings are clearly vestigial. We suspect the gems somehow keep it aloft."
—Tolarian research notes

name: Sapphire Medallion
text: Blue spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

name: Saprazzan Bailiff
text:
When Saprazzan Bailiff enters the battlefield, exile all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards.
When Saprazzan Bailiff leaves the battlefield, return all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards to their owners' hands.

name: Saprazzan Breaker
text: {U}: Put the top card of your library into your graveyard. If that card is a land card, Saprazzan Breaker can't be blocked this turn.

name: Saprazzan Cove
text:
Saprazzan Cove enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Put a storage counter on Saprazzan Cove.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Saprazzan Cove: Add {U} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

name: Saprazzan Heir
text: Whenever Saprazzan Heir becomes blocked, you may draw three cards.

editions.flavor: Within the walls of the floating city, Saprazzan wealth is like Saprazzan water: abundant, free-flowing, and accessible to all.

name: Saprazzan Legate
text:
Flying
If an opponent controls a Mountain and you control an Island, you may cast Saprazzan Legate without paying its mana cost.

name: Saprazzan Outrigger
text: When Saprazzan Outrigger attacks or blocks, put it on top of its owner's library at end of combat.

editions.flavor: The Saprazzans excel at both tactics: hit and run.

name: Saprazzan Raider
text: When Saprazzan Raider becomes blocked, return it to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Some quick dagger work and then back to the sea—that's the Saprazzan way.

name: Saprazzan Skerry
text:
Saprazzan Skerry enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Saprazzan Skerry: Add {U}{U} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Saprazzan Skerry, sacrifice it.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

name: Saproling Burst
text:
Fading 7 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with seven fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Saproling Burst: Create a green Saproling creature token. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of fade counters on Saproling Burst."
When Saproling Burst leaves the battlefield, destroy all tokens created with Saproling Burst. They can't be regenerated.

name: Saproling Cluster
text: {1}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token. Any player may activate this ability.

name: Saproling Infestation
text: Whenever a player kicks a spell, you create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

editions.flavor: "My army took centuries to gather," remarked Urza. "Yavimaya seems to conjure hers out of thin air."

name: Saproling Symbiosis
text:
You may cast Saproling Symbiosis as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each creature you control.

name: Sapseep Forest
text:
({T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.)
Sapseep Forest enters the battlefield tapped.
{G}, {T}: You gain 1 life. Activate this ability only if you control two or more green permanents.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

name: Sarcatog
text:
Exile two cards from your graveyard: Sarcatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Sacrifice an artifact: Sarcatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Sarcomancy
text:
When Sarcomancy enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Zombies on the battlefield, Sarcomancy deals 1 damage to you.

name: Sarcomite Myr
text:
{2}: Sarcomite Myr gains flying until end of turn.
{2}, Sacrifice Sarcomite Myr: Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"A horrible sight, yes, but the sounds . . . Its twanging tendons and grinding gears are almost musical."
—Brudiclad, Telchor engineer

"A horrible sight, yes, but the sounds . . . Its twanging tendons and grinding gears are almost musical."
—Brudiclad, Telchor engineer

name: Sarkhan's Rage
text: Sarkhan's Rage deals 5 damage to target creature or player. If you control no Dragons, Sarkhan's Rage deals 2 damage to you.

editions.flavor: The people of Tarkir speak of an ancient legend, of the dragon-man called Sarkhan who was greatest of all khans.

name: Sarkhan's Triumph
text: Search your library for a Dragon creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Sarkhan gazed on the world around him, the dragons sweeping through its skies, and joy kindled like a fire in his soul.

name: Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker
text:
+1: Until end of turn, Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker becomes a legendary 4/4 red Dragon creature with flying, indestructible, and haste. (He doesn't lose loyalty while he's not a planeswalker.)
−3: Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker deals 4 damage to target creature.
−6: You get an emblem with "At the beginning of your draw step, draw two additional cards" and "At the beginning of your end step, discard your hand."

name: Sarkhan the Mad
text:
0: Reveal the top card of your library and put it into your hand. Sarkhan the Mad deals damage to himself equal to that card's converted mana cost.
−2: Target creature's controller sacrifices it, then that player creates a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying.
−4: Each Dragon creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target player.

name: Sarkhan Unbroken
text:
+1: Draw a card, then add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
−2: Create a 4/4 red Dragon creature token with flying.
−8: Search your library for any number of Dragon creature cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Sarkhan Vol
text:
+1: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain haste until end of turn.
−2: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
−6: Create five 4/4 red Dragon creature tokens with flying.

name: Sarpadian Empires, Vol. VII
text:
As Sarpadian Empires, Vol. VII enters the battlefield, choose white Citizen, blue Camarid, black Thrull, red Goblin, or green Saproling.
{3}, {T}: Create a 1/1 creature token of the chosen color and type.

editions.flavor: The past still lives within its pages, waiting for its time to come again.

name: Saruli Gatekeepers
text: When Saruli Gatekeepers enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Gates, you gain 7 life.

editions.flavor: In Ravnica's wilder districts, nature still stirs, and its protectors still mind their posts.

name: Sasaya, Orochi Ascendant
text: Reveal your hand: If you have seven or more land cards in your hand, flip Sasaya, Orochi Ascendant.

name: Sasaya's Essence
text: Whenever a land you control is tapped for mana, for each other land you control with the same name, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced.

name: Saskia the Unyielding
text:
Vigilance, haste
As Saskia the Unyielding enters the battlefield, choose a player.
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, it deals that much damage to the chosen player.

name: Satyr Firedancer
text: Whenever an instant or sorcery spell you control deals damage to an opponent, Satyr Firedancer deals that much damage to target creature that player controls.

editions.flavor: His heart, the coal; his eye, the spark; his hand, the whirling flame.

name: Satyr Grovedancer
text: When Satyr Grovedancer enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor: "Some of my kin dance for themselves, without greater purpose. Nylea gives me purpose, and with it strength."

name: Satyr Hedonist
text: {R}, Sacrifice Satyr Hedonist: Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "Any festival you can walk away from wasn't worth attending in the first place."
"Any festival you can walk away from wasn't worth attending in the first place."

name: Satyr Hoplite
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Satyr Hoplite, put a +1/+1 counter on Satyr Hoplite.

editions.flavor: "Xenagos has become what he once despised: a tyrant and an oppressor."

name: Satyr Nyx-Smith
text:
Haste
Inspired — Whenever Satyr Nyx-Smith becomes untapped, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, create a 3/1 red Elemental enchantment creature token with haste.

name: Satyr Piper
text: {3}{G}: Target creature must be blocked this turn if able.

editions.flavor:
"When I asked my commander the reward for killing that prancing nuisance, he told me, ‘None! I want to kill him myself!'"
—Phrogas, soldier of Akros

name: Satyr Rambler
text: Trample

editions.flavor: A satyr is bound by nothing—not home, not family, not loyalty.

name: Satyr Wayfinder
text: When Satyr Wayfinder enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a land card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: The first satyr to wake after a revel must search for the site of the next one.
The first satyr to wake after a revel must search for the site of the next one.
The first satyr to wake after a revel must search for the site of the next one.
The first satyr to wake after a revel must search for the site of the next one.

name: Sauté
text: Sauté deals 3½ damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"Selecting the proper beeble is the key to a good sauté. The pinker the fur and the heartier the yelp, the more succulent the beeble will be when you pop it in your mouth."
—Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar,
The Underworld Cookbook,

name: Savaen Elves
text: {G}{G}, {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a land.

editions.flavor: "Purity of magic can only come from purity of the land. How can a meal nourish if the ingredients are spoiled?" —Sidaine of Savaen

name: Savage Alliance
text:
Escalate {1} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Creatures target player controls gain trample until end of turn.
• Savage Alliance deals 2 damage to target creature.
• Savage Alliance deals 1 damage to each creature target opponent controls.

name: Savage Beating
text:
Cast Savage Beating only during your turn and only during combat.
Choose one —
• Creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn.
• Untap all creatures you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.
Entwine {1}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Savageborn Hydra
text:
Double strike
Savageborn Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{R/G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Savageborn Hydra. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Savage Conception
text:
Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

editions.flavor: Some beasts are born not of a mother, but of magic.

name: Savage Firecat
text:
Trample
Savage Firecat enters the battlefield with seven +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever you tap a land for mana, remove a +1/+1 counter from Savage Firecat.

name: Savage Gorilla
text: {U}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Savage Gorilla: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn. Draw a card.

editions.flavor: These omnivorous gorillas have no qualms about a diet composed of equal parts fruit and Phyrexians.

name: Savage Hunger
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has trample.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Savage Knuckleblade
text:
{2}{G}: Savage Knuckleblade gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
{2}{U}: Return Savage Knuckleblade to its owner's hand.
{R}: Savage Knuckleblade gains haste until end of turn.

name: Savage Lands
text:
Savage Lands enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}, {R}, or {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Jund is a world as cruel as those who call it home. Their brutal struggles scar the land even as it carves them in its image, a vicious circle spiraling out of control.

name: Savage Offensive
text:
Kicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} as you cast this spell.)
Creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn. If Savage Offensive was kicked, they get +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Savage Punch
text:
Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control.
Ferocious — The creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn before it fights if you control a creature with power 4 or greater.

name: Savage Silhouette
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{1}{G}: Regenerate this creature."

editions.flavor: Some elves believe that their survival instincts are born of many cycles of reincarnation.

name: Savage Summoning
text:
Savage Summoning can't be countered.
The next creature card you cast this turn can be cast as though it had flash. That spell can't be countered. That creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Savage Surge
text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Untap that creature.

editions.flavor:
"I thought its back was turned!"
"A centaur has two backs!"
Gruul warriors never need to be stirred to battle. They need only to be shown where the battle is.

name: Savage Thallid
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Savage Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Savage Thallid: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice a Saproling: Regenerate target Fungus.

name: Savage Twister
text: Savage Twister deals X damage to each creature.

editions.flavor:
"Nature is the ultimate mindless destroyer, capable of power and ferocity no army can match, and the Gruul follow its example."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

"Frozen, we watched the funnel pluck up three of the goats—pook! pook! pook!—before we ran for the wadi."
—Travelogue of Najat

name: Savage Ventmaw
text:
Flying
Whenever Savage Ventmaw attacks, add {R}{R}{R}{G}{G}{G} to your mana pool. Until end of turn, this mana doesn't empty from your mana pool as steps and phases end.

name: Savannah
text: ({T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.)

editions.flavor:
Even the brave are scared by a lion three times: first by its tracks, again by its roar, and one last time face to face.
—Somali proverb

The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless, flat plains of their homeland.

name: Save Life
text:
Choose one Target player gains 2½ life; or prevent the next 2½ damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
Gotcha Whenever an opponent says "Save" or "Life," you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Save Life from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Who consistently managed to win.

name: Saving Grasp
text:
Return target creature you own to your hand.
Flashback {W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: Nothing's more valuable than perfect timing.

name: Savor the Moment
text: Take an extra turn after this one. Skip the untap step of that turn.

editions.flavor: The merrow took a moment for herself. She never gave it back.

name: Savra, Queen of the Golgari
text:
Whenever you sacrifice a black creature, you may pay 2 life. If you do, each other player sacrifices a creature.
Whenever you sacrifice a green creature, you may gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: "Nature's most raw beauty is the circle: perfect in its continuance, with no break between death and life."

name: Sawback Manticore
text:
{4}: Sawback Manticore gains flying until end of turn.
{1}: Sawback Manticore deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature. Activate this ability only if Sawback Manticore is attacking or blocking and only once each turn.

name: Sawtooth Loon
text:
Flying
When Sawtooth Loon enters the battlefield, return a white or blue creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Sawtooth Loon enters the battlefield, draw two cards, then put two cards from your hand on the bottom of your library.

name: Sawtooth Ogre
text: Whenever Sawtooth Ogre blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Sawtooth Ogre deals 1 damage to that creature at end of combat.

editions.flavor: "You will sharpen your teeth on my enemies' bones," Maraxus promised them, and his ogres cheered.

name: Sawtooth Thresher
text:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Remove two +1/+1 counters from Sawtooth Thresher: Sawtooth Thresher gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

name: Scab-Clan Berserker
text:
Haste
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
Whenever an opponent casts a noncreature spell, if Scab-Clan Berserker is renowned, Scab-Clan Berserker deals 2 damage to that player.

name: Scab-Clan Charger
text: Bloodrush — {1}{G}, Discard Scab-Clan Charger: Target attacking creature gets +2/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "The only roads I wish to see are those beaten flat by wild hooves."

name: Scab-Clan Giant
text: When Scab-Clan Giant enters the battlefield, it fights target creature an opponent controls chosen at random.

editions.flavor: For the Gruul, bone-crushing rage is the first priority. Accuracy comes in a distant ninetieth.

name: Scab-Clan Mauler
text:
Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)
Trample

editions.flavor: They inflict pain to forget their own and break foes to feel whole.

name: Scabland
text:
Scabland enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool. Scabland deals 1 damage to you.

name: Scald
text: Whenever a player taps an Island for mana, Scald deals 1 damage to that player.

editions.flavor:
"Shiv may be surrounded by water, but the mountains go far deeper."
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

name: Scalding Devil
text: {2}{R}: Scalding Devil deals 1 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: Demons massacre. Devils annoy.

name: Scalding Salamander
text: Whenever Scalding Salamander attacks, you may have it deal 1 damage to each creature without flying defending player controls.

name: Scalding Tarn
text: {T}, Pay 1 life, Sacrifice Scalding Tarn: Search your library for an Island or Mountain card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Scalding Tongs
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have three or fewer cards in hand, Scalding Tongs deals 1 damage to target opponent.

editions.flavor:
"This has nothing to do with what you know and everything to do with what I wish."
—Volrath

name: Scaldkin
text:
Flying
{2}{R}, Sacrifice Scaldkin: Scaldkin deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: The Temur believe that scaldkin are born when eruptions melt the frozen whispers of sleeping ancestors.

name: Scalebane's Elite
text: Protection from black

editions.flavor:
"With Rashida's blades, my guiding vision and the luck of the blessed, today we will free Mangara!"
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Scale Blessing
text: Bolster 1, then put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it. (To bolster 1, choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor:
"Your bravery honors us all."
—Dromoka, translated from Draconic

name: Scaled Hulk
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Scaled Hulk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Say, what rhymes with ‘run for your lives'?"
—Ku-Ku, akki poet

"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization
The wurms become so big, a single scale can be used as a roof for a human dwelling.
